decks.notes: The key concept of this UR Aggro Pioneer deck is to utilize a combination of low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By maintaining a fast pace and pressuring the opponent early on, the deck aims to overwhelm them before they can stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria, Skyclave Apparition, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to ramp up and cast powerful spells like Collected Company and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The inclusion of Ouroboroid and Enduring Innocence provides resiliency against removal spells, while Abandoned Air Temple and Boseiju, Who Endures offer additional utility. With a mix of early aggression and mid-game threats, this deck aims to outpace opponents and dominate the board.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with spells like Academic Dispute and Burst Lightning, while using creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to deal fast damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Shivan Reef and Steam Vents for mana fixing and efficient casting of spells. The inclusion of Experimental Synthesizer and Riverpyre Verge provides additional utility and card advantage. With a focus on quick damage and control, this UR Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game swiftly.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall the opponent's game plan while building up resources to eventually overwhelm them. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through flickering permanents. The deck includes a variety of lands that provide utility or card advantage, along with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and grind out a win through incremental advantages.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Ouroboroid, Badgermole Cub, and Combat Celebrant early on, supported by ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Gather Courage help pump up the creatures for faster damage output. Thornspire Verge and Copperline Gorge provide mana fixing, while Gene Pollinator adds versatility. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps search for key cards. The deck includes removal in the form of Mizzium Mortars and utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lair of the Hydra. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with fast, efficient creatures and spells.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board state by using cards like Mayhem Devil, Bloodtithe Harvester, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to deal quick damage to the opponent. The deck also includes synergies with Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven for additional value and consistency. With a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Deadly Dispute to control the board, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient creatures and powerful combos. Mana fixing and card advantage are also key components to ensure a smooth and powerful game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Lotus Field and various land cards to generate mana efficiently and quickly ramp into powerful spells and combos. By using cards such as Arboreal Grazer and Stock Up to accelerate land drops, the deck aims to reach a critical mass of lands to cast potent spells like Scapeshift. The deck also includes tools like Wishclaw Talisman and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods for card advantage and control, ultimately aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to utilize efficient creatures along with disruptive spells and abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Collected Company, Temple Garden, and creatures such as Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The deck also includes cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Aven Interrupter for additional threat and removal options. Overall, the goal is to establish a strong board presence and close out the game quickly.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. It aims to flood the board with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Skyclave Apparition while using the disruptive elements to slow down the opponent's game plan. Collected Company serves as a powerful card advantage tool, allowing the deck to continue applying pressure and overwhelming the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to win through aggressive creature-based strategies while disrupting the opponent's plan with disruptive elements.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board with cards like Enigmatic Incarnation and Leyline Binding while also using powerful creatures like Angel of Serenity and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to apply pressure. The deck also includes a variety of versatile spells and lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in gameplay. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Summon: Leviathan and Zur, Eternal Schemer provides additional win conditions and utility. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through strategic control and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's hand with Thoughtseize and Duress, removing threats with Vanishing Verse and Fatal Push, and gaining incremental advantage with Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser provide strong win conditions, while Gifted Aetherborn and Pest Control help stabilize the early game. The deck also utilizes Beza, the Bounding Spring for card advantage and Mutavault for additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through careful resource management and disruption.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to utilize low-cost spells and creatures to quickly control the board and deal damage to the opponent. By playing aggressively and efficiently, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early on and secure victory before the late game. The deck includes a mix of burn spells, aggressive creatures, and tempo-changing spells to disrupt the opponent's plans and maintain board presence. With a focus on speed and consistent damage output, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through relentless aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to take advantage of aggressive spells and creatures to put pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck includes cards that deal damage efficiently such as Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, while also incorporating creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear that benefit from casting spells. By using a mix of burn spells, creature aggression, and card draw through cards like Academic Dispute, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient damage output.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage, supported by burn spells like Fiery Impulse. The deck aims to apply early pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent provide card advantage and flexibility, while cards like Boomerang Basics and Experimental Synthesizer can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, ensuring that the aggressive creatures can hit the battlefield early and often.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game through a variety of counter spells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and control the board through various means such as counterspells like Dovin's Veto and removal spells like Supreme Verdict. The deck also includes card draw options like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive to ensure a steady stream of resources. Additionally, the inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional control options and card advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on a low-cost, aggressive strategy with a mix of small creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. By combining early creatures like Ornithopter and Novice Inspector with powerful creatures like Venerated Loxodon and Knight-Errant of Eos, this deck aims to apply pressure from the start and maintain board control throughout the game. With a mix of creature buffs and removal spells like Gleeful Demolition, the deck can adapt to different matchups and maintain aggression while disrupting opponents' plans.
